title: Louvre Guard Speaks of Robbery as Authorities Investigate Possible Inside Job | 10 News
description: A week on from the heist that's captured headlines around the world there's new speculation the Louvre thieves may have had help from the inside.  As the hunt for the culprits continues one of the museum's guards recounted what happened in the four-minute raid and the moment he stumbled upon one of the precious treasures. title: Matildas Turn Focus To European Champions England After Wales Win | 10 News
description: After a 2-1 win over Wales, the Matildas have immediately switched focus to their biggest test yet under coach Joe Montemurro - European champions, England.  Importantly, Sam Kerr made a successful return and was millimetres away from scoring. title: Man Arrested In India, Accused Of Inappropriately Touching Two Australian Cricketers | 10 News+
description: A man's been arrested in India, accused of inappropriately touching two female Australian cricketers in town for the World Cup. The two players say they were followed then touched by a man on a motorbike as they returned to their hotel from a cafe they had visited before. title: Dramatic Escalation In The US War On Drugs, Threats Of Missile Strikes | 10 News+
description: The world's largest aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald Ford, along with eight warships is tonight steaming towards central America in a dramatic escalation of the war on drugs.  For months the US has been destroying what they claim are drug boats leaving Venezuela and Colombia, and now its threatening missile strikes on land targets. title: Trump Slams UN, Accepts Nobel Peace Prize Nomination After Thai-Cambodia Peace Deal | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has claimed a peace accord between Thailand and Cambodia, while taking petty shots at the United Nations over the now-infamous teleprompter and escalator incidents.  Speaking in Kuala Lumpur following the signing of a ceasefire agreement between the two warring nations, Trump brought up how the UN "should be doing this" and that "they turned off my teleprompter when I made a speech." Trump also once again claimed the United States was the "hottest country anywhere in the world," and that ending wars was something "much more serious than a hobby" for him.  Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet glowingly thanked President Trump for his role in brokering the ceasefire accord - which also came with the announcement of a rare earth minerals deal between the US and Thailand - confirming he had formally nominated Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize. title: Destructive Storms Lash Brisbane And Parts Of South East Queensland | 10 News
description: More than 25,000 households remain without power after destructive storms battered Brisbane and other parts of south east Queensland with giant hail, damaging winds, rain and lightning.  Hundreds of videos posted to social media show the extent of the damage across the region with outdoor furniture seen flying off balconies including a bbq, along with golf ball-sized hail pounding down in backyards and a tree on fire after being struck by lightning.  There is a chance of more severe weather on the way, with Brisbane set to swelter through temperatures of up to 37 degrees today bringing on possible thunderstorms.  Watch 10 News Lunchtime at 1pm for more details. title: Tornado Destroys Roofs, Flattens Trees In Melbourne, Australia | 10 News
description: A "tornado" has blown roofs of houses, partially collapsed structures, and uprooted trees during a day of wild weather across Melbourne.  Residents in Werribee, in Melbourne's outer west, reported the tornado-like wind formation during a severe thunderstorm which swept across the city on Sunday afternoon.  Vision of the storm, and its aftermath, shows trees down across power lines, homes with roofs torn off, and some industrial structures partially destroyed. No injuries have been reported at the time of publishing. title: Jamaica Braces For Hurricane Melissa As It Strengthens To Category 4 Storm | 10 News
description: Hurricane Melissa has strengthened into a major Category 4 hurricane as it inches closer towards Jamaica.  The US National Hurricane Center has warned of catastrophic flash flooding and landslides across portions of southern Hispaniola and Jamaica, with torrential rains of up to 760 millimetres expected.  People on the island are being urged to seek shelter immediately, with the possibility of Melissa intensifying to a Category 5 storm on Sunday night, and likely to reach the southern coast of Jamaica as a major hurricane late Monday or Tuesday morning. title: Two Suspects Arrested Over Louvre Jewellery Heist | 10 News
description: French authorities have arrested two men in connection to the brazen Louvre jewellery heist.  The suspects in their 30s are reportedly known to police and are thought to be career criminals.  One arrest was made at Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris, where the man was allegedly about to flee to Algeria, another was arrested a short time later in an outer region of the capital.
